Class PortalDirective

A directive to automate the act of managing a ModalRegistry based on a boolean condition.

See Lit docs on Custom Directives.

render

  • render(showModal: boolean | Function, template: TemplateResult<ResultType> | (() => TemplateResult<ResultType>), closeCallback?: Function): void

  • Overrides Directive.render

    • Defined in src/portal.ts:35

    The core logic of the portal directive.

    If showModal is true, or if it is a Function that produces a truthy result, then the given template and optional closeCallback will be pushed to the <modal-portal>.

    If there already exists a registry for a modal sent using this exact directive, then it will be replaced using the new arguments.

    If showModal is falsy, then the modal is removed and the registry is reset.

    Parameters

    • showModal: boolean | Function
    • template: TemplateResult<ResultType> | (() => TemplateResult<ResultType>)
    • Optional closeCallback: Function

    Returns void
